Description: Fragment of handle-plate of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; on top: black-figure decoration consisting of siren or bird (head and one wing missing; with added red on remaining wing) to right; underside: glazed black (very worn); reserved around edge.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Alexandria 17025 and Oxford AN1896-1908-G.1250. Piekarski identifies the sherd as near the Hippolytos Painter on account of the decoration's similarities to a krater by the Hippolytos Painter in Munich, Staatliche Antikensammlungen 334.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 35, no. B4, pl. 10, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.204) (phase 3)
